subject: Business
title: The Ambidextrous Organization
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Ambidextrous Organization.

hook.text: Run today's business and invent tomorrow's at the same time. Most companies can't do both.

buildup.text: An ambidextrous organization exploits current strengths while exploring new opportunities.

discovery.text: Separate teams with different cultures: one optimizes, the other experiments. Shared leadership connects them.

twist.text: Without separation, the exploitation team always wins resources. Today's revenue outshouts tomorrow's potential.

climax.text: Amazon runs AWS as an independent unit. Its culture of experimentation is protected from retail's efficiency focus.

punchline.text: Protect the explorers from the optimizers. Both need to thrive.

quiz.question: Why do ambidextrous organizations separate exploration teams?
options: Current operations tend to consume all resources if teams share them
Employees can't learn two different skills
